website_summaries.verdict: A mid-sized sippy cup by a brand known for its quality baby products. However, the awkward lid design and quality concerns are disappointing.
pros: Superior cup quality that resists leaks, even when put to the test by toddlers
Handles are sturdy, removable, and easy to grip
cons: Attached lid may get in the way and flop onto baby's face while drinking
Some kids have difficulty learning how to drink from the cup

customer_reviews.title: Cap does come off for better use
customer_reviews.text: Great sippy cup for my 7 month old, we just started with it she's getting used it. I read all these review about the cap in the way! Just take the cap off easy fix, it does come off, you can easily take it off and on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am a fan!
customer_reviews.text: I introduced this cup to my son when he was about 8 months old. He took to it so easily, you would have never known it was the first time he was given a cup instead of a bottle. I love Dr. Brown! We used the bottles, now this cup! You always get excellent quality with Dr. Brown's products! Easy to clean. Leak proof/spill proof, I just toss it in my backpack and don't even need to make sure it is upright! I've only used it with water and pedialyte. Not sure how it would do with carbonated beverages, I've I noticed with my older child's cups that carbonation and leak proof straw cups don't work out.
customer_reviews.author: Lianne

customer_reviews.title: Redesign flop
customer_reviews.text: We had two of these cups and loved them. I ordered these a few months ago and they changed the cup design. I absolutely hate the new cups. The spillproof mechanism is no longer spill proof and my child doesn't even have to suck and it pours out all over him and he chokes on the drink. The old style was so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: I love it! It’s a great train cup
customer_reviews.text: I love it ! It’s a great train cup . My baby is only 5 months and it’s easy for him to grab it and drink from it , another good thing is that the handles are detachable so I can use it with other bottles . This is a great way to train baby to hold their own bottle
customer_reviews.author: Kendry

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this sippy cup
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this sippy cup! We used Dr. Brown bottles and now I have 7 of these cups (one for each day of the week). It was a very easy transition. You can easily remove the lid so your child won't play with it instead of drinking. The handle also adjusts easily. With other cups I couldn't get the handle to line up with the spout and this was very frustrating. The handle can also be removed later to not look so baby-ish. Great cup!
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sippy cup I have come across so far. I have tried a couple other cups and my baby was having a lot of trouble getting milk to come out, especially the Nuby brand. These work so great for him and he was able to use them right away. The cover is great to have on so that if the cup is dropped nothing will get on the spout, but it does tend to fall down and get in the way when the baby drinks by himself so we usually don’t leave it on. The only other thing that could be improved is to make the spout easier to get into to clean.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Only One Downside..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son to learn to use a sippy cup. It was easy for him to hold and easy to clean. It is leak-proof, but only if the nipple is seated correctly. This can sometimes take a few minutes to do. You have to pull it firmly and make sure it's all the way through the lid, and then push the outside lip all the way inwards. If not, it will get caught on the threads of the lid and will definitely leak. That's the reason for 4 stars (product design). As for the purchase, everything was excellent. Item as described. Fast shipping. Would recommend seller to others.
customer_reviews.author: Kris B.

customer_reviews.title: Very leaky!
customer_reviews.text: I got this cup because I used the same spouts in the Dr Brown bottles to transition to sippy cups. I liked the cup at first besides having to take the lid off every time we used it because it would fall and hit him in the face. It’s easy for him to hold and he uses the spout great. It was good the first few uses and washes but then it started leaking... just drips. But now no matter how tight you get the lid or adjust the spout part it leaks like crazy! This cup never leaves my sight when he uses just so he doesn’t lay it down.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Best sippy for transitional kids
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because my 7 month old daughter has recently started thinking she's too big to take a bottle but she definitely still needs one. This sippy is THE BEST! The handles make it easy for her to hang onto it with her teeny hands and the shape of the spout is perfect. What I've been most impressed with is it does not leak! She throws it, bites on it, and stings it around like a manic and it doesn't dribble formula all over.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaCharters

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is Too Soft
customer_reviews.text: My baby chewed on the collar of this cup and his wee little new milk teeth scratched deep grooves into it. You know given that this is for a child who is 6 months or older, I'm wondering how children with more than two weeny little teeth do when they chew on this cup: You know, the thing that babies do with their teeth....
customer_reviews.author: Silverwaters

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work For First Time
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 10 month old son. We've been using Dr. Browns' bottles exclusively since he was born. He did not have success with this sippy cup for his first time using one. The lid is always in the way, I took it off. He has to flip the cup upside down to drink and not easy to do when sitting or even walking around. I ordered another brand. Will save this until he gets bigger and try again.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Doolin

customer_reviews.title: Annoying and hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this cup, but I do not and neither does my daughter. The cap was annoying, but then it broke off and the was even more aggravating. I don't like it to be broken even though it is still fine to use. The handles swivel to much and my daughter doesn't like the spout. I found it difficult to take it apart for cleaning. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: tane63

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Not quite 5 stars... I wish the lid was more easily detachable; also, I wish the handles would remain stable, so my LO could get a better grasp; but, a good cup...my daughter does well with it and she’s 8 months
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: Want to love this
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a transition cup with connected lid to use on the go when I found this one. We have been using dr browns' bottles so I had high hopes for it. Yet it didn't turn out as great as expected. The lid constantly hits the baby's face as we tilt it upward. Also water leaks from the spout as the baby is drinking. I am not sure if it is because she hasn't figured out how to use it, but this doesn't happen with another training cup.
customer_reviews.author: Chen

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: The nipple on the bottle is SUPER tight and hard. My eight-month-old son with 5 teeth can’t even suck out water from it. He can just chew on it as a teething toy. I don’t recommend buy it as your baby’s first cup.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Johnson

customer_reviews.title: We like this cup and my son doesn't have a problem ...
customer_reviews.text: We like this cup and my son doesn't have a problem drinking from it, but the handles move and it makes it hard for my son to drink from sometimes. We prefer sippy cups with stationary handles and have bought other brands because of it. Also, the spout insert is a little difficult to insert.
customer_reviews.author: KOmiller

customer_reviews.title: Toddlers favorite, a little tough to clean
customer_reviews.text: These cups are great— easy to hold, solidly made, easy to read markings. My only complaint is that the plastic inner liner for the top is a bit tough to separate from the outer cap for thorough washing. It’s not strictly necessary each time, but it takes a lot of force to get the mouthpiece through the cap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: nipple can't be sterilized
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I had to rip the top closure off as it was in the way of my babies face. The flow was very slow as well. I disassembled the spout from the cup to sterilize it since moisture can get trapped at the top. Now the spout piece doesn't fit/seal and it's no longer usable. Waste of money. Still on the hunt for the perfect cup.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin S

customer_reviews.title: Transition from boy to man maybe
customer_reviews.text: It takes the lungs of ten young men to pull a drop of water out.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Hard to drink from
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely leak proof -- so much so that it's nearly drink proof. I tried to sip from it myself and it was tough getting more than a tiny drop out at a time. The parts themselves are easy to clean, however detaching and reattaching the spout to the lid is tricky and time consuming. Baby struggled with it so we stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Anomalisa

customer_reviews.title: Cup is easy to hold and use for my 7 month old ...
customer_reviews.text: Cup is easy to hold and use for my 7 month old son. The drinking spout is soft and flexible. There are not too many pieces and cleaning is easy. Item arrived quickly. Item came with a coupon from the seller and so I will order additional items in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Not my fav
customer_reviews.text: Baby didn't like this one. I didn't like taking it apart & putting it back together. I normally love all things Dr. Brown's, but unfortunately not this sippy cup. If baby had liked it I would have put up with the maintenance though. May be good for other babies
customer_reviews.author: Jacie LaFreniere

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok cup. Our son won't drink out of it. It's hard to clean and put back together quickly and easily. I would not recommend this cup overall. The handles are oddly situated and my son could not tip it and drink without the cover hitting him in the face.
customer_reviews.author: meaghan van veen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old son was able to get off of the bottle rather quickly after I purchased these transition cups. They are extremely easy for him to hold and drink from with absolutely no spills. They are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Kim T

customer_reviews.title: Great cup for my son
customer_reviews.text: Great learning cup, my n has a clef lip and needs palate repair and this seems to be a good for for him to learn, only down fall is the lid, he want to play with it, luckily it is able to remove nicely and all is well
customer_reviews.author: Robert Blackorbay

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: My child has really loved everything from Dr.Brown and is now easily moving from bottles to cups thanks to this product. I really do recommend this over anything Tomny Tippy or Mam has on the market. Save your money and get this!
customer_reviews.author: bridav

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the bottle
customer_reviews.text: My son bites through everything but not this. I had to take his bottle away at 13 months. This cup was a great replacement. He's now 17 months and still uses this along with spoutless cups. I don't use the lid unless storing in the fridge. It has started to leak a little when on it's side. Love that the handles are separate and everything comes apart to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: The best sippy cups!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have known about these with my first born. These are great sippy cups to start with & end. My 15 month old loves them, easy for him to use and handle. And absolutely doesnt spill. And he throws them all over the place. I ordered 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: dee carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Easy Clean!
customer_reviews.text: I have a super lazy 1 year old who refuses to use sippy cups if there’s no handles and this one is his favorite! I love how it comes completely apart for cleaning and I can get in all the crevasses with a quick twist or pull.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: i love them and he drinks so easily
customer_reviews.text: transitioning from bottle to sippy cup currently with my 7 month son. i bought 2 of these! i love them and he drinks so easily!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: It is good quality but cover is easy fall down , not easy to clean special kid drink milk or juice.
customer_reviews.author: Nationwideus

customer_reviews.title: Handles are easy to hold tho
customer_reviews.text: The straw tip on this is a lot harder than I expected for a transition cup. Even I had trouble sucking water from this. Wasn't please with this cup and will be looking for another "transition from bottle" sippy cup. Handles are easy to hold tho!
customer_reviews.author: koojoocoo

customer_reviews.title: Good, but handles spin
customer_reviews.text: My son is having the hardest time holding this to his mouth because the handles spin around.
customer_reviews.author: Araina Eber

customer_reviews.title: The top is annoying
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t much of a fan. The top cover is somewhat of a nuisance—I ended up just taking it off each time my son would try drinking from it. My son tried this cup but ended up preferring the straw training cups
customer_reviews.author: The Q’s

customer_reviews.title: Quality bottle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my infant nephew, and his mother says it’s worked out great for him. She’s had trouble getting him to use a bottle, but this one has been good for them.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Best sippy cups!
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy loves these sippy cups. We usually take the kids off but it’s nice to have the option to leave it on and protect the mouthpiece. So easy to clean and take places. We’ve actually got 4 of these. Easy to learn how to drink out of too.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid cup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend who’s baby is getting just a little bit older. Doctor browns is one of my favorite brands for babies and this sippy cup seems pretty nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Ransdell

customer_reviews.title: Great Sippy Cup for Transition
customer_reviews.text: These are my FAVORITE Sippy Cups for my son who is 11 months old. They are easy to use, easy to grip (he prefers them without the handles - I like that you can detach the handles on this particular cup). Good transitional cup from Dr. Brown's bottles. The flow isn't super fast either, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Best bottle and now best sippy cup!
customer_reviews.text: As most moms have done, I went through about four different types of sippy cups trying to figure out what my daughter would use and like. I used Dr Browns bottle and she naturally took to this sippy cup. I had to transition her quickly due to her daycare requiring no more bottles past a certain age. She switched within 24 hours no problem! I love Dr Browns sippy cups, so easy to clean and for baby to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Laub

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: If your baby has drank from Dr Brown’s bottles, this is a must because graduating to spoutless sippy cups. Handle comes off if you want.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: So not impressed. I expected the quality of this brand. Hard to clean, very cheap plastic. Threw away, was not worth cupboard space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy for my LO to hold by herself and the nipple on this is fairly soft (not like regular Sippy cups that are just hard plastic) which she appreciates because of course she likes to bite everything,
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Evans

customer_reviews.title: The holy grail of sippy cups
customer_reviews.text: This is the first sippy cup I've found that DOES NOT leak! I've been through a lot of cups and tossed every single one of them - but this one is a keeper. My search is done! I'm buying these from now on.
customer_reviews.author: The Johnsons

customer_reviews.title: The only negatives are that the handle spin around (which isn't horrible, he seems to like it) and the lid
customer_reviews.text: I got this cup to help transition my son to sippy cups. He loves it and it's the only cup he will use, mainly because the spout is the same material as his bottles. The only negatives are that the handle spin around (which isn't horrible, he seems to like it) and the lid, a great concept but it gets in the way and he pinched his finger in it so I just took it off. It's a good cup overall though, would probably buy another
customer_reviews.author: Katie Keller

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully designed cup
customer_reviews.text: High quality first sippy cup. My 11 month old grandson isn't quite ready for it but will keep trying until he gets the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri1658

customer_reviews.title: They don't last
customer_reviews.text: Product is poorly made. Had to keep buying them over and over because it's my sons favorite sippy cup. The spout portion cracks and falls apart after a few months of use.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Soft spout for transition
customer_reviews.text: This cup works great for our little one. The soft spout makes drinking water easier for him and he was able to get the hang of drinking out of this couple after a week of trying. We have had the best success using this cup after the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: The only cup we use!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only sippy cup my son can use without aspirating, the flow rate is much slower than other cups, but he does not have to work hard to get water out at the same time. We put all the pieces in the dishwasher which is very convenient. It is also very durable, my son likes to throw it onto the tile in the dining room a lot, the pops off occasionally, but easily goes right back on.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: Why is this bottle leaking? Every time she tips the cup to drink from it, all the milk ends up leaking out and onto her clothes. It made a huge mess, and wasted a lot of good milk from this exact-producer :( would NOT recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J Lai

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, leaks everywhere, we use Dr. Brown bottles for feeding, but the Avent cup is superior for sippy/transition.
customer_reviews.author: cblossoms

customer_reviews.title: Dr. Brown is always good
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s cute. Easy to clean and great for traveling. Baby however did not like the lid on it when he was using it
customer_reviews.author: ConShaMano

customer_reviews.text: I got this because my daughter loved it as a baby so I decided to get it for my son and unfortunately he did not like it. It was hard for him to get the water out and he would get frustrated and cry.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Lid snaps shut, hard to unpack
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Very difficult to take out of packaging. That alone made me sorry i bought it. Then the lid keeps snapping closed so baby was just sucking on the lid and not getting any water . What good is a cup if baby cant drink from it? What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The plastic spout doesn't click/fit into the lid. No matter how we tried, there was no way to tighten /screw on the lid without the plastic spout twisting within the cup. Not sure how this is even a product on the market. We love Dr. Brown bottles otherwise. Very disappointed in this sippy cup. Thumbs down!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Castro

customer_reviews.title: Great cup
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this cup , it's easy for him to hold , and it's another amazing product by Dr brown!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Schafer

customer_reviews.title: ... months old and can drink out of it just fine however the handles spin so I have to reposition ...
customer_reviews.text: My son is 8 months old and can drink out of it just fine however the handles spin so I have to reposition them often. Also, I wish the lid came off because he has come close to pinching his fingers multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Completely broken and cracked, saw it suffered severe damage when I opened it. I requested a new item and will update my review once I receive my replacement that I am actually able to use.
customer_reviews.author: Garret Socha

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: My son loooovvveeesss this bottle nothing else has to be this one. And I’m glad because they are cheep and very easy to clean and they don’t leak
customer_reviews.author: Keith Burns

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Buy
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic sippy cup to help transition your baby from a bottle to a toddler sippy cup! My son absolutely loves using them! I love that the lid is attached but comes off for easy cleaning, the nipple part is easy to unattach and attach for easy cleaning, and the cup itself holds up against the numerous falls off the highchair!
customer_reviews.author: Connie-Marie Ringler

customer_reviews.title: Love love this cup I use only dr brown cup ...
customer_reviews.text: Love love this cup I use only dr brown cup but my son like this one more than all the bottles we use so far thanks dr brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold cup for 6 months to 2 years child. My son loves to drink out of this cup.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony P.

customer_reviews.title: I liked that the cap stayed attached so you couldn't lose ...
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this, I liked that the cap stayed attached so you couldn't lose it, unfortunately the cap hits my baby in the face when he tries to drink. It is also difficult to put the silicone valve back into the lid.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mountz

customer_reviews.title: Michael love this sippy  cups
customer_reviews.text: I will keep buying ,nice quality, product ,you will need to remove lid and just put it back as you needed. Baby will get scare .over all I been buying this product for 1 year and half my toddler won't drink his milk if is not this cup.
customer_reviews.author: Eda

customer_reviews.title: Best sippy cup
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this sippy cup !! It’s very light ! It prevents air bubbles. The cover on the top comes off which I like as well . As many times as my lo has dropped and threw this sippy around It is still in great shape. Totally recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ray Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Best bottle
customer_reviews.text: The best bottle we have ever used for my toddler. He is addicted to it. I love how easy it is to clean. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Divya

customer_reviews.title: Loves these sippy cups!
customer_reviews.text: My daughters love these cups! We are a Dr.Browns family! We have tried other cups these don't leak! Easy to handle and use.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley E. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: The perfect sippy cup!
customer_reviews.text: These are the ONLY sippy cups my son will drink from! No leaks, easy to hold. We always take off the top cover because it distracts him (he’s 1).
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Easily Broken
customer_reviews.text: My son loved these cups, they don't leak, they're easy for him to hold and drink out of...until they broke from him dropping them. He is 10 months old and just from dropping it from his high chair they split right open, he broke two in a matter of days.
customer_reviews.author: kolby

customer_reviews.title: Great for transitioning from bottle!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for transitions from bottles to cups! You do need to take it apart to clean but it’s easy to assemble and to hold for little hands.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My son was very picky to start on sippy cups. After reading reviews and asking around we purchased this and he loves it. Durable and easy to clean. Great for on-the go too.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Dislike
customer_reviews.text: Hate this. My baby didn’t like it. I don’t consider it a transition nipple at all. The sippy nipple is hard and is nothing compared to the normal OG Dr.Brown nipples. Ugh. Off to my next sippy cup.
customer_reviews.author: JaneCo

customer_reviews.title: Great to transition from bottle to silly cup
customer_reviews.text: We started using this for our baby when he was 6 months. It was very easy for him to transition because the flow seemed to be similar to the 4-12 month bottle flow. He loves holding the bottle himself too! Hold up very well and are excellent quality!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Gay

customer_reviews.title: The best sippy cups
customer_reviews.text: Very leak proof and perfect for my 11 month old daughter. These are her and our favorite sippy cup she has.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: silicone spout valve is not easy sip
customer_reviews.text: It is kind of hard for my niece to use. The silicone spout valve is not easy to sip. She can not get anything out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cup
customer_reviews.text: This was the only sippy cup my son would use. We love it. The only downfall is that you have to be very mindful of how you put the mouth piece in or it will leak. Would definitely recommend though
customer_reviews.author: Myrna Vaden

customer_reviews.title: Needs redesign.
customer_reviews.text: The lid is annoying, often have to remove it for my son to use it. Also the handles move around making the spout position awkward for my son.
customer_reviews.author: TexRex

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: My sons loves these! I also find is super easy to clean as they don’t have so many pieces and parts.
customer_reviews.author: The Dez’s

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn't come off
customer_reviews.text: The lid is hinged on. While its nice to keep the lid attached so you don't lose it...it bonks the baby in the face when trying to use it.
customer_reviews.author: wjt

customer_reviews.title: Great soppy cup
customer_reviews.text: My son loves dr browns products would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Christina Pastrano

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing sippy cup for an active child
customer_reviews.text: This sippy cup is the BEST sippy cup ever! My little boy loves to turn his sippy cup upside down,throw it, chew on it you name it & not once has it leaked! So from a mom that has went thru numerous brands this one is the best all around sippy cup!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Bought this one for the cap but ended up taking ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one for the cap but ended up taking the cap off because it kept closing on my LO.
customer_reviews.author: Cpeg2015

customer_reviews.title: Good Cup
customer_reviews.text: Good sippee cup. Bought several and my son likes them.
customer_reviews.author: tsimp

customer_reviews.title: It's leak proof and reasonably priced you will love it
customer_reviews.text: My 9 month old grandson Noah loves it his 2 yr old sister Amelia had one he loved it but it was pink so mawmaw .me bought him his own and we love Dr browns
customer_reviews.author: neverwill4getcody

customer_reviews.title: Very awkward nipple
customer_reviews.text: Dr. Brown sippy cup did not work for us. The nipple and top of the cup are very awkward for 7 month old baby. Additionally, the flip top tends to slap baby in the face.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany White

customer_reviews.title: Quality cup
customer_reviews.text: Love these cups. Only cup like it with a lid that attaches and my child can hold well! Only 3 parts to clean- love this!
customer_reviews.author: Syd Guest

customer_reviews.title: great but handles do not stay in one place
customer_reviews.text: great but handles do not stay in one place. they rotate freely and can make it difficult for a baby to hold the bottle
customer_reviews.author: Victor Kononenko

customer_reviews.title: Not easy for baby to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first sippy cup we bought our 8 month old. The handle doesn’t stay stationary and the spout is rock hard and is not easy to get anything out of it. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: not the best transition cup out there.
customer_reviews.text: We love our Dr. Browns bottles, but this is not the best transition cup. To get any water out you must sip quite strongly. Our 6 month old can't get anything out of this cup yet. I would recommend this product for an older baby.
customer_reviews.author: Pearlite

customer_reviews.title: Need replacement nipples
customer_reviews.text: My dtr has really like these the last year. They are her favorite for milk. Only thing they will start to leak if opening gets worn down. Its a big bummer there arent replacement nipples for them, have to buy all new cups.
customer_reviews.author: Bcd

customer_reviews.title: I loved that the cup does not spill and its easy ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my friends baby who has a tonguetie. The baby was having a hard time sucking from a cup. This cup helped the baby wean from the bottle to a cup. I loved that the cup does not spill and its easy for the baby to grip. I didn't like that the cup has the lip. The baby keeps trying to pull it off . lol
customer_reviews.author: Cherokee Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Used this cup with both of my kids. Perfect transitioning cup!
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Great Cup
customer_reviews.text: We use these exclusively for our sons smoothies. Easy for him to get it out, easy to hold and it does not spill. Have re-purchased another because the first was so good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P Norris

customer_reviews.title: Old ones were better
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice cup, easy for my little one to hold on to but it leaks. The old styled Dr. Browns sippy cups did not leak. Glad I still have 2 of the old style. If it's not broke, don't fix it.
customer_reviews.author: lazyks2000

customer_reviews.title: Great cup !
customer_reviews.text: Great cup my 5 month old grabs it easily and can drink from it . Sturdy and easy to hold .
customer_reviews.author: Thechoiceofnyc

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 for my daughter because these are the only sippy cups she likes !
customer_reviews.author: Idalia

customer_reviews.title: Great sippy cup!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 year old didn’t like drinking his milk in anything other then his bottles. I purchased the sippy spouts from Dr.Browns for his bottles then bought this cup, so easy of a transition! It doesn’t leak and holds up to all the throws! Hands down a great cup for transitioning!
customer_reviews.author: Jilliane Carrozza

customer_reviews.title: My daughter hated it. The cap is not sturdy at all
customer_reviews.text: I tried to wean my daughter off the bottle by purchasing this product. My daughter hated it. The cap is not sturdy at all. After my daughter throws it on the floor twice, it cannot be put back on anymore.
customer_reviews.author: chan jing

customer_reviews.title: Love this cup
customer_reviews.text: Best transition cup! My little one is slowly transitioning to using sippy cups. He was not sure about this at first and there are some things I would change on the design but once he used it more, he has adjusted to it and we give him a little water from it which he drinks without spilling down his chin now.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Good for transition
customer_reviews.text: The sippy cup helped transition my infant from bottle to sippy cup when many other cups failed to get his interest. The lid came off the groove very easily. Other than that this is a good sippy cup for transition.
customer_reviews.author: BV

customer_reviews.title: Not for beginners! Top too hard to suck the water.
customer_reviews.text: My son is 7 months and he finds it hard to suck the water out of the top. It appears to be hard. May not be ideal for beginners. We will try this brand again in a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer s.

product_meta.title: Dr. Brown's Soft-Spout Transition Cup, 6 oz (6m+), Blue, Single
product_meta.description: Color:BlueThe best way to help baby make the easy transition from bottle to cup. The "first cup" on the market is now even better with sturdy, contoured handles that make it easier than ever for little hands to get a comfortable grip. Features a one-piece, spill-proof silicone spout valve that makes sipping easy for tiny mouths, and is also removable for easy cleaning. Attached lid stays open when baby drinks and keeps spout clean when not in use. Easy to assemble and clean, this transitional sippy cup is dishwasher safe and recommended for babies 6 months+. 6 Ounce ./180 ml. Choose from a selection of vibrant colors.
feature_bullets: The best way to help baby make the easy transition from bottle to cup
Sturdy, contoured handles that make it easier than ever for little hands to get a comfortable grip
One-piece, spill-proof silicone spout valve that makes sipping easy for tiny mouths, and is also removable for easy cleaning
Attached lid stays open when baby drinks and keeps spout clean when not in use
Easy to assemble and clean and is dishwasher safe - 6 Ounce ./180 ml. - Recommended for babies 6 months+
